item.title: Sarah add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I don't like that man. I must get to know him better." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?" -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Do not fear to be eccentric in opinion, for every opinion now accepted was once eccentric." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "In all affairs it's a healthy thing now and then to hang a question mark on the things you have long taken for granted." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Even if the open windows of science at first make us shiver after the cozy indoor warmth of traditional humanizing myths, in the end the fresh air brings vigor, and the great spaces have a splendor of their own." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "War does not determine who is right - only who is left." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The fundamental cause of the trouble is that in the modern world the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "I think we ought always to entertain our opinions with some measure of doubt. I shouldn't wish people dogmatically to believe any philosophy, not even mine. " -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "I do not pretend to be able to prove that there is no God. I equally cannot prove that Satan is a fiction. The Christian god may exist; so may the gods of Olympus, or of ancient Egypt, or of Babylon. But no one of these hypotheses is more probable than any other: they lie outside the region of even probable knowledge, and therefore there is no reason to consider any of them." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "Let children learn about different faiths, let them notice their incompatibility, and let them draw their own conclusions about the consequences of that incompatibility. As for whether they are ‘valid,’ let them make up their own minds when they are old enough to do so." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "Beware the irrational, however seductive. Shun the 'transcendent' and all who invite you to subordinate or annihilate yourself. Distrust compassion; prefer dignity for yourself and others. Don't be afraid to be thought arrogant or selfish. Picture all experts as if they were mammals. Never be a spectator of unfairness or stupidity. Seek out argument and disputation for their own sake; the grave will supply plenty of time for silence. Suspect your own motives, and all excuses. Do not live for others any more than you would expect others to live for you." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Denis Waitley
item.description: "The greatest gifts you can give your children are the roots of responsibility and the wings of independence." -- Denis Waitley

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Johann wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Divide and rule, a sound motto. Unite and lead, a better one." -- Johann wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "By seeking and blundering we learn." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "All things great are wound up with all things little." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Sarah add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Do you think amethysts can be the souls of good violets?" -- L.M. Montgomery
